actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.

official_title: Expressing the sense of Congress regarding graduated driver's license programs.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) each State should examine the benefits of establishing a graduated driver's license program if it does not have one, and if it does, to fully monitor, review, and improve it; (2) the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration should continue its studies and programs regarding the effects of such programs on improving automobile safety; and (3) specified entities and groups should be praised for their successful efforts to educate the public regarding the benefits of graduated driver's license programs and to establish such programs in many States.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress regarding graduated driver's license programs.
